facts: The world's most expensive pizza costs $12,000 and takes 72 hours to make.
Americans eat approximately 350 slices of pizza per second.
The first pizza delivery was made in 1889 to Queen Margherita of Italy.
October is National Pizza Month in the United States.
The largest pizza ever made was over 13,000 square feet - bigger than a basketball court.
Pepperoni is America's favorite pizza topping, appearing on 36% of all pizzas ordered.
Ancient Egyptians, Romans, and Greeks all ate flatbreads with toppings similar to pizza.
There are approximately 61,269 pizzerias in the United States.
The Hawaiian pizza was actually invented in Canada, not Hawaii.
NASA funded research to develop a 3D printer that can make pizza for astronauts.
The word 'pizza' first appeared in a Latin text from 997 AD in Southern Italy.
Regular pizza dough needs to rise for 24-72 hours for the best flavor.
The world record for fastest pizza maker is making 3 pizzas in 32 seconds.
Mozzarella cheese makes up about 80% of all cheese used on pizzas in America.
In Japan, you can order pizza with toppings like squid, eel, and mayo.
The pizza box was invented in 1966, revolutionizing pizza delivery.
Thin crust pizza has fewer calories than thick crust pizza of the same size.
Pizza Hut was the first company to deliver pizza to outer space in 2001.
